function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Variability in study design and settings may affect generalizability of results and recommendations.","Impact":"Inaccurate or limited recommendations for disease mitigation in specific settings.","Mitigation":"Conduct meta-analyses to consolidate findings and identify universal mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Meta-analysis software, data analytics tools.","People":"Healthcare workers, policymakers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Limited number of participants in some studies may result in skewed or unreliable findings.","Impact":"Unrepresentative or biased findings leading to inappropriate disease prevention strategies.","Mitigation":"Encourage multi-center studies with larger sample sizes to improve the reliability of findings.","Technologies":"Collaborative research platforms, data sharing and pooling tools.","People":"Researchers, funding agencies, public health authorities.","Owner":"Research institutions, funding agencies."},{"Description":"Inclusion of studies conducted before COVID-19 vaccinations were available may limit the applicability of findings to the current environment.","Impact":"Outdated or irrelevant recommendations for disease prevention in the context of widespread vaccination.","Mitigation":"Conduct additional studies in the post-vaccination era to assess the impact of vaccination on disease propagation.","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools, longitudinal study platforms.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health researchers, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."}]}
